thread.title: Browns' quarterback alumni not exactly the cream of the crop Shaw's You Said It
thread.title_full: Browns' quarterback alumni not exactly the cream of the crop -- Bud Shaw's You Said It | cleveland.com

author: Bud Shaw, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Browns' quarterback alumni not exactly the cream of the crop Shaw's You Said It
text:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- You Said It is based on the premise that the only thing Cleveland sports fans need more than a championship is a sense of humor...
YOU SAID IT
Hey Bud: With him likely taking his team to the playoffs, will the Browns trade a #1 pick to acquire Brandon Weeden for next year to solve their QB problems? Or should they focus on someone younger, like Brett Favre ? -- Wayne
I don't see Weeden going anywhere. Jerry Jones swears he is "fully committed to Whatshisname."
Bud: We have First Energy Stadium, Progressive Field and now First Merit Convention Center. Would you consider selling the naming rights to your Spin column? -- Jay Shulman
Yes. If I can find a company that prides itself on being the antithesis of merit, energy and progress.
Bud: I see the Indians announced division series playoff tickets will go on sale October 2 nd . Why do they want me to buy a ticket just to watch players clean out their lockers? â€“ Paul Ferko, Parma
 Critics of Carlos Santana would say it's a chance to see him do his best work in the cleanup position.
Bud: How many diminutive wide receivers does it take to create a quarterback controversy? -- Vince G., Cincinnati
Ray Farmer has tried to explain this to you several times. Short receivers are only height challenged five to 10 times a game.
Hey, Bud: The mantra for the Browns "words into action" got me wondering
if the mantra for "You Said It" contributors is "inaction into words." -- Nelson
You Said It winners see no big change in their so-called lives.
Hey, Bud; When was the last time that the Indians and Browns were both in the playoff hunt this late in the season? --Tim, Twinsburg
Some You Said It winners strive to be the best of a mediocre field.
